Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi,
    I am reading the SOAP 1.2 spec. (http://www.w3.org/TR/soap12-part0/=
) . I understand that "few people use SOAP 1.2 and of those that do, even f=
ewer use the WebMethod property" [Ref: Stefan T.]. Given that caching is en=
abled because a) one can change the verb to a GET (with the SOAP Response M=
EP) and b) that the URI is unique, I am struggling to understand why it has=
 not been adopted more?

Thanks,
Sean.
